alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 2:19PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Numerous strong thunderstorms will impact portions of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties through 300 PM PDT... At 216 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking numerous strong thunderstorms from just northwest of the Cottonwood Visitor Center, to just south of Twentynine Palms. Storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West
